meanings.definition: To remove or expel from a position or place.
meanings.sent1: The principal was ousting the troublemaker from the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to oust the CEO due to poor performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat was ousting the mouse from its hiding spot behind the couch.
meanings.sent4: The storm was ousting the leaves from the trees with strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was ousting the weeds from the flowerbed to make it look neat.

meanings.definition: The act of forcing someone out of a position or place.
meanings.sent1: The ousting of the dictator brought relief to the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The board meeting discussed the ousting of the current chairman.
meanings.sent3: The ousting of the cat from the warm spot by the fireplace was met with protest.
meanings.sent4: The ousting of the old traditions paved the way for new ideas to flourish.
meanings.sent5: The sudden ousting of the goalkeeper surprised everyone in the stadium.
